snippet: S.E.C. filings show that Dov Charney, the company’s founder and former chief executive, has enlarged his ownership stake and may be within striking distance of regaining control of the company.
abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission filings show that ousted American Apparel founder Dov Charney has bought 27 million shares of its stock, and may be within striking distance of regaining control of the company.
lead_paragraph: S.E.C. filings show that Dov Charney, the company’s founder and former chief executive, has enlarged his ownership stake and may be within striking distance of regaining control of the company.

headline.main: Dov Charney Raises Stake in American Apparel
headline.print_headline: Filings Show Fight to Lead American Apparel
